title: Bulk Upload Security Findings
description: Import multiple findings from VAPT or security assessment

findings.title: SQL Injection Vulnerability in Login Form
findings.description: The login form on /auth/login endpoint does not properly sanitize user input, allowing SQL injection attacks. An attacker can bypass authentication by injecting malicious SQL code.
findings.remediation: Implement parameterized queries or prepared statements for all database interactions. Use input validation and sanitization. Consider using an ORM framework that automatically prevents SQL injection.
findings.remediation_notes: Priority 1: Must be fixed before production release

findings.title: Missing Security Headers
findings.description: The application does not implement critical security headers including X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, and Content-Security-Policy. This leaves the application vulnerable to clickjacking and XSS attacks.
findings.remediation: Configure web server or application to include the following headers: X-Frame-Options: DENY, X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff, Content-Security-Policy: default-src 'self', Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000
findings.remediation_notes: Can be implemented through middleware or web server configuration

findings.title: Weak Password Policy
findings.description: The current password policy allows passwords with only 6 characters and does not enforce complexity requirements. This makes user accounts vulnerable to brute force attacks.
findings.remediation: Update password policy to require: minimum 12 characters, at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number, and one special character. Implement account lockout after 5 failed attempts.
findings.remediation_notes: Should align with IM8 AC-2 requirements

findings.title: Insufficient Audit Logging
findings.description: The application does not log security-relevant events such as failed login attempts, privilege escalation attempts, and data access by administrative users. This limits incident response capabilities.
findings.remediation: Implement comprehensive audit logging for all security-relevant events. Ensure logs include timestamp, user identifier, event type, source IP, and outcome. Retain logs for at least 90 days.
findings.remediation_notes: Required for IM8 AU-1 and AU-2 compliance
